**Rory McCann** (born 24 April 1969) is a Scottish actor, best known for
portraying [Sandor "The Hound" Clegane](/wiki/Sandor_Clegane "Sandor Clegane")
on the HBO series _[Game of Thrones](/wiki/Game_of_Thrones "Game of Thrones")_
and Lurch in [Edgar Wright](/wiki/Edgar_Wright "Edgar Wright")'s crime-comedy
_[Hot Fuzz](/wiki/Hot_Fuzz "Hot Fuzz")_.

## Early
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Rory_McCann&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early life")]

McCann was born in [Glasgow](/wiki/Glasgow "Glasgow"), Scotland.[2] He has a
sister, Sally-Gay McCann, born in 1972.[3]

Before becoming an actor, McCann was a painter who studied at the Scottish
School of Forestry near [Inverness](/wiki/Inverness "Inverness"). He also
worked as a bridge painter (on the [Forth Road Bridge](/wiki/Forth_Road_Bridge
"Forth Road Bridge")), landscape gardener and carpenter.[4] Rory McCann was
first trained as an actor by writer-artist Robert Parsifal Finch in The
Actor's Workshop, Glasgow. 1998.

##
Career[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Rory_McCann&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Career")]

McCann's first acting job was as an extra on the film
_[Willow](/wiki/Willow_\(film\) "Willow \(film\)")_ (1988). He was fired
because he laughed during the takes.[5] He appeared in an advertisement for
[Scott's Porage Oats](/wiki/Scott%27s_Porage_Oats "Scott's Porage Oats"),
dressed in a vest and [kilt](/wiki/Kilt "Kilt").[5] As his first major acting
role, McCann played a disabled [personal trainer](/wiki/Personal_trainer
"Personal trainer") in the 2002 television comedy drama _[The Book
Group](/wiki/The_Book_Group "The Book Group")_ , winning the Scottish
[BAFTA](/wiki/BAFTA "BAFTA") for the best television performance of 2002.[6]

Since then, he has taken television roles as Detective Inspector Stuart Brown
in _[State of Play](/wiki/State_of_Play_\(TV_serial\) "State of Play \(TV
serial\)")_ , [Peter the Great](/wiki/Peter_the_Great "Peter the Great") in
_Peter in Paradise_ , and a priest in the award-winning British comedy drama
series _[Shameless](/wiki/Shameless_\(UK_TV_series\) "Shameless \(UK TV
series\)")_.

He made his Hollywood debut in the 2004 film
_[Alexander](/wiki/Alexander_\(2004_film\) "Alexander \(2004 film\)"),_ which
required the actors to go through a boot-camp in the African desert, and
included shooting in [Thailand](/wiki/Thailand "Thailand"),
[Morocco](/wiki/Morocco "Morocco") as well as a [London](/wiki/London
"London") studio.[7] In 2007, he appeared as Michael "Lurch" Armstrong in
_[Hot Fuzz](/wiki/Hot_Fuzz "Hot Fuzz")_. In 2008, he played Moby in _[The
Crew](/wiki/The_Crew_\(2008_film\) "The Crew \(2008 film\)")_ and [Atilla the
Hun](/wiki/Atilla_the_Hun "Atilla the Hun") in the [BBC](/wiki/BBC "BBC")
[docudrama](/wiki/Docudrama "Docudrama") _[Heroes and
Villains](/wiki/Heroes_and_Villains_\(TV_series\) "Heroes and Villains \(TV
series\)")_.

McCann portrays [Sandor "The Hound" Clegane](/wiki/Sandor_Clegane "Sandor
Clegane") in the [HBO](/wiki/HBO "HBO") series _[Game of
Thrones](/wiki/Game_of_Thrones "Game of Thrones")_.[8][9][10]

Other projects include a [BBC](/wiki/BBC "BBC") TV Series by writer [Jimmy
McGovern](/wiki/Jimmy_McGovern "Jimmy McGovern") called
_[Banished](/wiki/Banished_\(TV_series\) "Banished \(TV series\)"),_ set in
Australia in the 18th century.[11] McCann plays a blacksmith named Marston.

## Personal
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Rory_McCann&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Personal life")]

McCann's younger sister, Sally-Gay McCann, works on costumes for film and
television; he worked alongside her on _Alexander_ and _Game of Thrones_.[3]
McCann is a supporter of the [Scottish Green Party](/wiki/Scottish_Green_Party
"Scottish Green Party"), and appeared in its [2007 Scottish Parliament general
election](/wiki/2007_Scottish_Parliament_general_election "2007 Scottish
Parliament general election") broadcast.[12]

In 1990, McCann broke multiple bones in a near-fatal rock climbing accident in
[Yorkshire](/wiki/Yorkshire "Yorkshire").[13]

McCann is the former frontman of a defunct band called Thundersoup.[7] He
plays the piano, guitar, banjo and mandolin.[14]

McCann is known for living a solitary, transient lifestyle.[5] He often lives
on his boat or in places without modern conveniences.[15][16]
